Posted By: mmertk (8/26/2012 10:49:05 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: [Dark Withering](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Withering) is a great card to pitch to this. For {R}{B} you probably get the equivalent of two [Terminate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terminate)s early game (it's unlikely that both the creatures you want to take out are resistant to one of the spells unless your opponent is mono-black, although allowing regeneration is unfortunate), and if you're running hellbent it helps empty your hand in the meantime.
posts.html:
Dark Withering is a great card to pitch to this. For {R}{B} you probably get the equivalent of two Terminates early game (it's unlikely that both the creatures you want to take out are resistant to one of the spells unless your opponent is mono-black, although allowing regeneration is unfortunate), and if you're running hellbent it helps empty your hand in the meantime.

Posted By: LordRandomness (1/1/2012 5:51:53 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Add to a [Pyromancer Ascension](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pyromancer Ascension) deck? Although those builds are have so many tools already, this thing dumps a card in your graveyard before it's even cast, should you choose that option. You can ditch on Lightning Axe to the cost for another, and the discarded axe will be in the graveyard before the one you're casting is considered cast, giving you a counter on your ascension, and one step closer to taking out *two* [Baneslayer Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Baneslayer Angel)s.
posts.html:
Add to a Pyromancer Ascension deck? Although those builds are have so many tools already, this thing dumps a card in your graveyard before it's even cast, should you choose that option. You can ditch on Lightning Axe to the cost for another, and the discarded axe will be in the graveyard before the one you're casting is considered cast, giving you a counter on your ascension, and one step closer to taking out two Baneslayer Angels.
